meanings.definition: The art of describing or mapping a region or district.
meanings.sent1: In her chorography, she beautifully depicted the layout of the city with detailed maps.
meanings.sent2: The chorography of the national park helped visitors navigate the trails and landmarks.
meanings.sent3: During the geography class, the students had fun creating their own chorography of imaginary lands.
meanings.sent4: Her chorography of the neighborhood was so accurate, it felt like looking at a painting.
meanings.sent5: The artist's chorography of the countryside was so vivid, it felt like stepping into a picture.

meanings.definition: A description or mapping of a region or district.
meanings.sent1: The old book contained a detailed chorography of the ancient city, complete with illustrations.
meanings.sent2: The explorer's journal provided a valuable chorography of the uncharted territory.
meanings.sent3: The children drew a playful chorography of their neighborhood, marking all the important spots.
meanings.sent4: His words painted a chorography of the bustling city, capturing its essence.
meanings.sent5: The historian's chorography of the battlefield brought the past to life with clarity.
